politics:
1. Introduction
Fastorika Limited (the 'Company', 'we', 'us') respects your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains what data we collect, how we use it, and what rights users have.

2. The data we collect
Fastorika Limited collects the following categories of information/data:
2.1 Identification data – name, date of birth, passport data, customer IDs.
2.2. Contact information – address, phone number, email, social media accounts.
2.3. Payment and transaction information – partial data of cards/bank accounts/accounts in payment systems, transaction history.
2.4. Technical information – IP address, cookies, device information, log files.

3. How we use the data
Your data is processed exclusively for the following purposes:
3.1. Fulfillment of contractual obligations (transfer processing, verification, account maintenance).
3.2. Compliance with legal requirements (AML/KYC/CFT).
3.3. Ensuring the security of the service and fraud prevention.
3.4. Sending information messages (with the possibility of refusal).
3.5. Use for marketing and promotion purposes (with the possibility of opt-out only).

4. Transfer of data to third parties
We transfer data only in the following cases:
4.1. Payment providers and banks for processing transfers.
4.2. Government agencies, if there is a legal requirement.
4.3. Contractors providing technical infrastructure, KYC services and anti-fraud systems.

5. Data retention periods
5.1. In accordance with 4AMLD, 5AMLD, 6AMLD and local laws, your data will be stored for at least 5 years and may be stored for up to 10 years after the end of the business relationship.
5.2. If the legislation requires longer storage (for example, for investigations), the period may be extended.
5.3. After the expiration of the storage period, the data will be deleted or anonymized.

6. User rights (in accordance with GDPR)
You have the right:
6.1. The right of access is to request a copy of your data.
6.2. The right to rectification is to make changes or corrections to the data.
6.3. Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten') – you can request the deletion of data, however, if their storage is required in accordance with AML/CFT, we are required to store them for 5-10 years.
6.4. The right to restrict processing is to suspend the use of your data for certain purposes (for example, marketing).
6.5. The right to data portability is to receive a copy of your data in a machine–readable format.
6.6. Right to object – to refuse processing for marketing or mailing.
6.7. The right to complain is to contact the national data protection supervisory authority.

7. Contacts
On issues related to data processing:
• Support: support@fastorika.com

8. Conclusion
By using the Fastorika service, you confirm that you have read and agree to this Privacy Policy.
privacytitle: Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Policy
privacy:
1. Introduction
This Policy sets out the framework adopted by Fastorika Limited (“the Company”) to prevent its services from being used for money laundering (ML) or terrorist financing (TF) purposes. Fastorika Limited is committed to complying with international standards, including the FATF Recommendations, EU Anti-Money Laundering Directives (4AMLD, 5AMLD, 6AMLD), GDPR, and the relevant legislation of Belize and other jurisdictions in which the Company operates. The objective of this Policy is to establish clear standards and internal procedures for customer due diligence (CDD), enhanced due diligence (EDD), ongoing monitoring, record-keeping, and reporting of suspicious activities to the competent authorities.

2. Regulatory Framework
This Policy is based on the following legal and regulatory frameworks:
- Financial Action Task Force (FATF) 40 Recommendations
- EU Anti-Money Laundering Directives (4AMLD, 5AMLD, 6AMLD)
- GDPR (data protection obligations)
- Belize Anti-Money Laundering legislation
- Other local AML/CFT laws applicable to the jurisdictions where Fastorika operates

3. Scope
This Policy applies to all employees, directors, contractors, and partners of Fastorika Limited. It covers all services, transactions, and business activities of the Company, including IT solutions, platform services, and any financial-related integrations.

4. Risk-Based Approach
The Company adopts a risk-based approach to AML/CFT. Clients and transactions are classified into risk categories:
- Low Risk
- Medium Risk
- High Risk (e.g., PEPs, high-value transactions, offshore jurisdictions)

Risk factors include geographical risk, product/service risk, client type, and transaction patterns.

5. Customer Due Diligence (CDD/KYC)
Fastorika Limited performs the following measures:
- Identification of customers (name, DOB, nationality, address, valid ID)
- Verification of identity documents
- Enhanced Due Diligence for high-risk clients
- Verification of Source of Funds (SoF) and Source of Wealth (SoW)
- Ongoing monitoring of client activities

6. Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs)
The Company applies Enhanced Due Diligence to all identified PEPs. Screening tools and databases are used to detect PEPs, their family members, and close associates.

7. Sanctions & Prohibited Activities
Fastorika Limited screens all customers against international sanctions lists (UN, EU, OFAC, UK). The Company does not onboard clients from FATF high-risk jurisdictions or clients involved in prohibited activities.

8. Transaction Monitoring
The Company monitors all transactions using automated and manual tools. Alerts are generated for unusual or suspicious activities, including structuring, smurfing, and transaction-based financial crimes (TBFC).
9. Reporting

Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) are filed with the competent authority in Belize (FIU Belize) or in the jurisdiction of operation. Reports must be submitted immediately upon detection of suspicious activity.
10. Record Keeping

Customer records, transaction history, and KYC documentation are kept for a minimum of 5 years after the end of the business relationship. In some cases, data may be retained for up to 10 years as required by law.
11. Training & Awareness

All employees of Fastorika Limited must undergo AML training at least once a year. Training covers identification of suspicious transactions, KYC procedures, and reporting obligations.
12. Internal Controls

Fastorika Limited appoints a Money Laundering Reporting Officer (MLRO) responsible for AML compliance, reporting to regulators, and overseeing internal monitoring systems.

13. Enforcement
Failure to comply with this Policy will result in disciplinary actions, which may include termination of employment or cooperation, and reporting to relevant authorities.
termsTitle: Terms & Conditions of Fastorika Limited Service
terms:
Introduction
These Terms of Use (the "Terms") govern access to and use of the website, software solutions, and other services provided by Fastorika Limited, incorporated under the laws of Belize (registration number 000050785) (the "Company" or "Fastorika").
By using the Fastorika website, software or services, you (the "User" or "Client") confirm that you have read these Terms, understand their content and agree to comply with them in full.
If you do not agree with any provision of these Terms, you must immediately stop using the Fastorika website and services.
This agreement is a public offer in accordance with the laws of Belize and is legally binding from the moment you start using Fastorika.

A. General Terms of Use
1. Right to use
By using the Fastorika website and services, you acknowledge that:
• You are at least 18 years of age or the age of majority in your country of residence.
• You have full legal capacity to enter into contracts and accept legal obligations.
• You will use the service solely for lawful purposes and in accordance with these Terms.

Fastorika does not provide services to persons who:
• Reside in jurisdictions where the use of such services is prohibited by law;
• Are under sanctions or restrictions imposed by international organizations or state bodies;
• Act on behalf of third parties without proper authorization.

2. Modification of Terms
Fastorika reserves the right to change, supplement or update these Terms at any time.
Changes take effect from the moment they are published on the official Fastorika website (fastorika.com). By continuing to use the site or services after publication of the updated Terms, the User confirms consent to their new version. In case of disagreement, the User must stop using Fastorika services.

3. Prohibited Activities
The User agrees not to use the Fastorika website, software, or services for any illegal, fraudulent, or unauthorized activities, including but not limited to:
• Violation of laws of Belize, the User's country of residence, or international norms including AML/CFT rules and sanctions regimes.
• Providing false, incomplete, or misleading information when registering or using the service.
• Attempts to interfere with the operation of the site, circumvent security measures, or gain unauthorized access to data or accounts.
• Transmitting or distributing viruses, malicious code, programs, or scripts.
• Posting spam, advertising messages, phishing links, or other unwanted materials.
• Transactions related to money laundering, terrorist financing, illegal trafficking, gambling or other prohibited activities.
• Attempts to circumvent identification, verification (KYC), or transaction monitoring procedures.
• Using the service on behalf of a third party without legal grounds or power of attorney.
Fastorika may restrict, suspend or terminate access if violations are detected or illegal activity is suspected.

4. Intellectual property rights
All materials on the website and in Fastorika services (texts, logos, trademarks, designs, software, source code, databases, structure, interface) are the exclusive property of Fastorika Limited or used under license. The User is granted a limited, non-transferable right to use the Content solely for lawful purposes within these Terms.
The User is prohibited, without prior written consent of Fastorika, to copy, distribute, modify, decompile, or otherwise exploit elements of the Site or software; create derivative products; use Fastorika's brand name, logo, or trademarks for commercial purposes.

5. Availability of the Service
Fastorika strives for uninterrupted operation of the platform but does not guarantee continuous availability or absence of errors. Access may be restricted for maintenance, third‑party failures, or force majeure. Fastorika is not liable for indirect losses due to temporary unavailability. The Company will minimize downtime and, where possible, notify users in advance.

6. Use of Third‑Party Services
Certain functions, including transfer processing, identification (KYC) or currency exchange, may be performed by external licensed partners who operate under their own terms and privacy policies. Fastorika is not responsible for actions or failures of such third parties. Interaction with third‑party services is at the user's own risk.

B. Description and Nature of Services
1. Nature of services
Fastorika provides access to an online platform enabling interaction between users and external licensed financial providers. The service allows requests for transfers, tracking of status, and receiving notifications and tools. Fastorika is a technological solution provider (SaaS) and does not accept, store, transfer, convert or manage user funds. All financial transactions are carried out exclusively by licensed third parties.

2. No licensed financial activity
Fastorika Limited operates in IT only and is not a bank, electronic money institution, payment institution, investment, trust or brokerage company, nor a provider for storing or managing client funds. Fastorika does not operate in Belize and does not provide services to residents of Belize. In accordance with IFSC Act and IBC Act of Belize, such activities do not require licensing.

3. Commissions and fees
Using Fastorika services may involve service fees for access to functions or processing requests, indicated prior to confirmation. Fastorika does not charge fees for fund transfers performed by third‑party providers. Third‑party commissions are set independently and may be automatically deducted. Fastorika does not control or refund third‑party fees.

4. Limits and restrictions
Fastorika and partners may set limits (transaction amount, count per period, by country/currency/user category) for compliance with law, preventing fraud, and ensuring stability. Operations may be suspended or rejected if limits are exceeded or additional verification is required.

5. Responsibility for data accuracy
The User is fully responsible for the accuracy and relevance of all data provided during registration and use. Fastorika and its partners process transactions based solely on user‑entered data and are not responsible for delays or losses caused by incorrect information.

6. Currency conversion
Currency conversion rates are determined by licensed providers and shown until confirmation. The final amount credited may differ due to bank/provider fees or rounding. Fastorika does not control third‑party fees or final conversion results.

C. Refund Policy
Refunds are possible only when a transaction was not successfully executed or confirmed by a third‑party provider. Fastorika is not responsible for refunds where the operation has been completed and confirmed by the relevant provider.
